intro: Oxyceros patulus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved oxyceros, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and prominent yellow stamens. Oxyceros patulus is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
